column3: An expression used when one remembers or realizes something because of what the other person has just said
If you look someone in the eye or look them in the eyes, you look at them directly, often to try to make them believe what you are saying
Experience an emotional or mental breakdown
To do more than is acceptable
Seem as old as you really are and not younger or older
Exist or be there for a short time and then stop or leave
Be too well known or obvious to need to be mentioned
Consider the positive aspects of a negative situation
To put in a lot of effort, energy, or work to achieve something
